questions.text: Howard Hughes was a prominent figure in motion pictures, but he was equally prominent in what other area?
questions.explanation:
Aviation.

	Before the weirdness crippled him, Hughes was a pilot and businessman of talent and ability

questions.text: Jason Miller won a Pulitzer prize for his play, 'That Championship Season'. He also had a key role as an actor in what movie?
questions.explanation:
The Exorcist.

	He did a fine job there, too

questions.text: Vincent Price is known for his acting (and for his great voice). He was, however, also an accomplished collector. What did he collect?
questions.explanation:
Art.

	He apparently had a fine collection.

questions.text: Byron White is best known as a justice of the U.S. Supreme Court. Prior to that he was an outstanding athlete. In what sport?
Carl Sandburg is best known as a poet, but he also wrote an impressive biography of this American president.
Fred Grandy was successful as an actor in 'The Love Boat'. Later, he became a congressman. From what state?
John Wilkes Booth is known as Lincoln's assassin. Prior to that, however, he enjoyed fame in another capacity.
questions.explanation:
Actor.

	The Booth family consisted of many actors, including the renowned Edwin Booth

questions.text: Lew Wallace wrote Ben-Hur (and other works). He also served as a U.S. governor. Where?
Shirley Temple (Black) was legendary as a child star. Later, she worked in a totally different capacity.
Davy Crockett is famous as a frontiersman and as a defender in the Alamo. He also served in Congress. What state did he represent?
questions.explanation:
Tennessee.

	'Born on a mountaintop in Tennessee ...'
